adhoc0.message: Note: Teachers need to send links to students, and students can join breakout rooms voluntarily by clicking the links.

adhoc1.message: Step 1: Group students, there are several ways

adhoc11a.message: (Click here for explanation) Why can't I see any students in the grouping area?

adhoc12a.message: (Click here for explanation) Why can't I see all students?

adhoc13b.message: Make sure the main classroom link is green in the 'Classroom Settings' tab and that the 'Nickname' is the last 10 characters of the Google Classroom meet link. Then click the 'Initiate Main Room' button.

adhoc1a.message: Random Grouping: Click the 'Random' button. You can continue to click the button until you find a grouping you like. You can also manually adjust groups by dragging and dropping students between groups (second method).

adhoc1b.message: Manual Adjustment: Hold the student's name and drag it between groups.

adhoc1c.message: Exclude from Random Grouping: Click the student's name to toggle exclusion.

adhoc1d.message: Manual Exclusion: Hold the student's name and drag it to the left.

adhoc2.message: Steps 2 and 3: Copy breakout room links and student group lists

adhoc2a.message: Once you have properly grouped students, click

adhocAutosend.message: New!!! Automatically send breakout assignments to meet chat

audioFixFallback.message: How to opt-in to this solution?

audioFixFallback2.message: Close any open Meet sessions (if any)

audioFixFirst.message: How to opt-in to this solution?

audioFixIntro.message: I recommend leaving this option checked (default state). If you encounter speaker instability or other issues after enabling this option, please email robert@hudektech.com. Unchecked (o) uses the old solution (not recommended). If you switch the state (x or o), remember to restart all Meet sessions as the setting changes the speaker mode, which can cause the extension to misidentify the speaker state (on or off). Again, I recommend keeping it checked (X).

audioFixOptin.message: How to opt-in to this solution?

audioFixOptin2.message: Close any open Meet sessions (if any)

audioFixSecond.message: If you encounter issues with the new solution, you can revert to the original solution

audioFixTitle.message: New solution for random speaker stuttering issues

audioHeadline.message: How to fix speaker stuttering issues, click here

btnRam.message: Open video, use slider to open videos in turn

checkRam.message: Low RAM option: For RAM below 8G

checkRamOld.message: Low RAM option: Usually not selected. If RAM is below 8G, you can select it. After selection, the main room and breakout rooms will still open, but only one window can be viewed at a time. Using the slider will synchronize closing the current video and opening the next video

default1.message: If the above account is correct, no further action is needed

default2.message: If the account is incorrect, please follow the instructions below

default3c.message: to manage the order of Google accounts

default5a.message: Your Google Meet account is the first account you sign in with. If the account you want to use is not the first one, you must first sign out of all accounts, then sign in again, this time making the first account the one you want to use for Google Meet

default5b.message: It is important to use the same account to set up and initiate the meeting

default5c.message: The account used to set up and initiate the meeting is considered the owner of the Google Meet account

default6.message: Sign in again in the correct order, and you can set up and initiate meetings

errorAutoCreateLink.message: There was an issue automatically applying for a meet link from Google. Please ensure you are signed in to your Google account. If already signed in, please use this link to sign out and sign in again: https://accounts.google.com/SignoutOptions. This will sign you out of all currently signed-in accounts (sorry for the inconvenience), then ensure the first account you sign in with is your teaching Google account. Sign-in order is important; the first account you sign in with will be your Google Meet account.

errorBouncingBalls.message: There is a meet window that cannot sync. Please close all currently open meet windows, including this control panel, then reopen this control panel, and reinitiate the main room and breakout rooms. Rest assured, closing the meet window will not delete or interfere with the students inside. If you have many open windows, you may not find all the meet windows. In this case, the simplest method is to close all currently open windows and reopen them, because if an old meet window remains, the extension will still be unable to practice syncing. ***No need to delete the extension and re-download. Just close all currently open meet windows first, then reopen this control panel, and use this control panel to open the main room and breakout rooms.

errorNick1.message: There was an issue automatically generating a link for the nickname:

errorNick2.message: Please ensure you are signed in to your Google account. If already signed in, and confirmed that your Google account is Google Suite, Education, etc., which provides the nickname feature (general free Google accounts do not provide the nickname feature). If your account provides this feature and is signed in, please use this link to sign out and sign in again: https://accounts.google.com/SignoutOptions. This will sign you out of all currently signed-in accounts (sorry for the inconvenience), then ensure the first account you sign in with is your teaching Google account. Sign-in order is important; the first account you sign in with will be your Google Meet account. If your Google account does not provide the nickname feature, please create only static (dark blue) or code (light blue) links

extDesc.message: Only the teacher needs to install. Completely Free and your Data is Private.  Google Classroom integration, Slider Control.

extName.message: Google Meet Breakout by Robert Hudek

firstRoomMain.message: The first row is the main room, the rows after are breakout rooms

genAutoEnter.message: Allow 'outsiders' to automatically enter the room

genAutoEnter1.message: If selected, outsiders can automatically join through the room link

genAutoEnter2.message: Usually recommended not to select (leave blank)

genAutoJoin.message: For rooms managed by this extension, automatically press the 'Join' button when initiated. This is a convenient feature

genAutoNewUrl1.message: Each time a meeting is initiated, a new meet URL link will be automatically generated. This option is a safe method but managing the room process will become a bit more complicated. You need to initiate the meeting first to know what the link is, then notify (send to) students the new link. Usually, this feature is more suitable for breakout rooms. If selected for the main room, you need to initiate the main room first, know the new link, and send the new link to students (via email, SMS, etc.), so they know how to enter the main room (what the URL is).

genAutoNewUrl2.message: Please note: This option only applies to 'static' type room links (dark blue) in the room settings tab.

genAutoNewUrl3.message: Other types of room links (green nicknames, light blue codes) are not affected by this option.

headline1a.message: Free to use, no data leaks,

helpCode1a.message: The code consists of 12 characters: three characters, a '-', four characters, a '-', and three characters. An example is: abc-defg-hij. Note to keep the two hyphens.  This code is the 12 characters following 'https://meet.google.com/' in the Google Meet URL, for example: https://meet.google.com/sik-akes-ilq?user=0. Here, the code is sik-akes-ilq

helpNickname1b.message:
A nickname is a name freely chosen by the teacher, used to conveniently initiate a Meet. Within an organization (such as a school), the 'nickname' is a unique name, so be careful not to use a name already used by another teacher, otherwise it will interfere with that teacher's Meet. To avoid duplicate nicknames, schools can set rules for creating nicknames: full name, course, or free choice. For example: huhaoyang_math1_050810. Two schools being different organizations will not conflict with each other.

Note: Nicknames must be in English.

helpNickname1c.message: You must use English for nicknames

helpNickname1d.message: Also, do not enter any URL prefixes in the nickname. For example, g.co/meet/ or meet.google.com/lookup/ in the nickname is not allowed. Exception is that Google Classroom teachers can enter the full meet link, explained below

helpNickname2a.message: Here teachers can enter the entire 'meet link' from Google Classroom, and the extension will automatically filter out the last 10 characters from this meet link, which is the randomly assigned 'nickname' from the Google Classroom system.

helpNickname3.message: For example, my Google Classroom meet link is https://meet.google.com/lookup/g45j4fubqb. I copy and paste this entire URL, and the extension will automatically filter out and retain the last 10 characters: g45j4fubqb. This is the 'nickname' randomly assigned by Google Classroom, g45j4fubqb

helpUrl1a.message: URLs are flexible. An example is the full Google Meet URL: https://meet.google.com/abc-defg-hij. Or perhaps a website the teacher wants to use in class, such as: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Astronomy, or https://www.freecodecamp.org/, or YouTube https://youtu.be/C4_uJmH9hmc

msgAllSync.message: Success: All meet windows synced (All successfully synced)

msgBreakoutSync.message: Success: All breakout rooms synced (Breakouts successfully synced)

msgMainSync.message: Success: Main room synced (Main room synced)

muteAllRooms.message: Mute all: Main and All Breakout Rooms

popupHelpAdhocNumwords2b.message: characters, which is below the 500-character limit for a single copy-paste, so you can copy-paste it all at once.

popupHelpAdhocNumwords2d.message: characters, which exceeds the 500-character limit for a single copy-paste, so you need to copy and paste a few lines at a time into the main room chat, each time no more than 500 characters.

popupHelpAdhocNumwords3b.message: characters, which is below the 500-character limit for copying and pasting at once, so you can copy and paste it at once

popupHelpAdhocNumwords3d.message: characters, which exceeds the 500-character limit for copying and pasting at once, so you need to copy and paste in sections: highlight a few lines, copy and paste them into the main room chat. Each time not exceeding 500 characters.

pre1.message: Step 1: Copy the pre-arranged group list

pre1a.message: For example, copy the group list from an MS Word document and paste it into the main room chat. This way, students will know their assigned chat rooms

pre1b.message: For each copy and paste, note that Google Meet chat has a 500-character limit, so you may need to copy and paste multiple times

pre2.message: Step 2: Copy the breakout room links

pre2c.message: then paste them into the main room chat

preNumwords2b.message: characters, which is below the 500-character limit for copying and pasting at once, so you can copy and paste it at once

preNumwords2d.message: characters, which exceeds the 500-character limit for copying and pasting at once, so you need to copy and paste in sections: highlight a few lines, copy and paste them into the main room chat. Each time not exceeding 500 characters.

roomsDupe.message: Cannot save: Duplicate room names or links. All must be unique

roomsHowCode1.message: The code consists of 12 characters, in this format: three characters, a '-', four characters, a '-', and three characters. An example is

roomsHowCode2.message: The code is not randomly created by you, but by Google Meet. For example, if you use this URL: https://meet.google.com/new, a new meet will be initiated, and in the URL you can see these 12 characters, which is your code

roomsHowCode3.message: The code is static because it always initiates the same meet URL.

roomsHowGc1.message: Please copy the meet link from the Google Classroom homepage, then paste it in the link field here. For example, my meet link is https://meet.google.com/lookup/g45j4fubqb. After pasting in the link field, the extension will remove the preceding characters https://meet.google.com/lookup/, leaving the last 10 characters. In my example, it leaves

roomsHowGc3.message: If the main room is initiated by this extension, the extension and Google Classroom will already be synced. If the main room is initiated on the Google Classroom webpage, you must press the 'Initiate Main Room' button in the 'Happy Classes' tab under 'Start Class' in the extension, which will sync the extension with Google Classroom.

roomsHowGcnick1.message: An example is the full meet URL

roomsHowGcnick3.message: In the link field, you can enter the full meet link, or the last 10 characters. If you enter the full URL, the extension will remove the preceding characters, leaving only the last 10 characters. In this example, it is g45j4fubqb

roomsHowGcnick4.message: Google Classroom nicknames are green because they are dynamic, changing URLs each time they are initiated

roomsHowNick1.message: An example of a nickname is

roomsHowNick2.message: Nicknames cannot contain any URL prefixes, such as g.co/meet/ or meet.google.com/lookup/. Nicknames are freely chosen, can include numbers, but must be in English (must use English nicknames, no Chinese characters)

roomsHowNick3.message: Class nicknames are green. Nicknames are dynamic, changing URLs each time they are initiated

roomsHowStart1.message: In the link field, leave it blank. Click the (blue) save button, the system will automatically apply for a meet link from Google and save it here. You only need to fill in the room name. This automatic link is a static link that will not change

roomsHowTypes1.message: There are three types of links, explained below

roomsHowUrl1.message: If you leave the link field blank, the extension will

roomsHowUrl3.message: apply for a link URL from Google and save it. Or you can directly enter a full URL in this format:

roomsHowUrl4.message: Meet URLs are static because they always initiate the same URL without changing. However, in the 'General Design' tab, there is an 'Auto Initiate New URL' checkbox, if this option is selected, a new URL will be automatically generated each time it is initiated. If you select this option, be sure to notify students of the new URL after initiation. This option is more suitable for breakout rooms rather than the main room

roomsHowUrl6.message: Data URLs need the full URL, including https://. An example is

roomsHowUrl7.message: Data URLs are flexible and can be a science website, math website, history website, music website, etc.

roomsNeedName.message: Cannot save: Each room needs a name

sim11.message: On the Meet tab of this control panel, open the Main room and your Breakout Rooms (for example, 3 breakout rooms). If you haven’t created your breakout room links yet, go to the Rooms tab and create your rooms and links there.

sim13.message: Select the number of simulated students. If you're just trying it out, we recommend opening 3 breakout rooms with a total of 6 simulated students, assigning 2 students to each breakout room.

sim15.message: Google Meet has recently implemented a restriction that limits the number of active Meets with an operational microphone to 8 on a single computer. This means that on your computer, you can open 1 Main room and up to 7 Breakout rooms and still have a working microphone in each of these rooms. You can, however, have as many students as you want in your Main room or Breakout Rooms, such as 50 or more students, without affecting the microphone functionality.

sim16.message: For this simulation, which is all done on your one computer, if you open 1 Main room, 3 Breakouts, and 6 simulated students, some of the simulated students will not have operational microphones, but this is perfectly fine for testing purposes. Since all the Meets are running on the same computer, you likely will not be using your microphone due to potential feedback issues. However, you can still experiment with the control panel buttons and see how they control the different Meets.

sim18.message: For these practice sessions, since you'll have many meetings open on your screen, we recommend selecting the Breakout Format as 'Tabs' instead of the default 'Tiles'. You can choose this using the radio button in the 'Breakout Room Format' section just above. This will help organize your 'teacher' meetings on the left side of the screen in a single window with tabs, while the right side will display the simulated student meetings in a single window with multiple tabs. When teaching your actual class, you can select either 'Tiles' or 'Tabs', depending on your preference, since your screen will only display your teacher meetings, giving you more space to work with.

sim2.message: If you're new to this extension and want to get a feel for how it works, you can try it out using simulated students. This simulation can be done entirely on your computer students.

sim4.message: When using this extension to teach your class, only you, as the teacher, need to install it. Students do not need to install the extension as they won't be using it.

sim7.message: Go to your Chrome extensions page at

sim7a.message: Find the Google Meet Breakout extension, click on the Details button, and scroll down to turn on the 'Allow in Incognito' option.

sim9.message: Once you're done practicing, you can turn off the 'Allow in Incognito' setting. In normal use of this extension, you will not need to use incognito mode for your students.

warning8Rooms.message: Google Meet microphone has limit of 7 breakout rooms
